verses.kjv: Run ye to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and know, and seek in the broad places thereof, if ye can find a man, if there be any that executeth judgment, that seeketh the truth; and I will pardon it.
verses.ct: "Search through the streets of Jerusalem — look carefully and investigate. Check the public squares to see if you can find even one person who acts justly and pursues truth, and I will forgive the city."

verses.kjv: And though they say, The LORD liveth; surely they swear falsely.
verses.ct: Even when they say, 'As surely as the LORD lives,' they are making false oaths.

verses.kjv: O LORD, are not thine eyes upon the truth? thou hast stricken them, but they have not grieved; thou hast consumed them, but they have refused to receive correction: they have made their faces harder than a rock; they have refused to return.
verses.ct: LORD, don't you look for honesty? You struck them, but they felt no remorse. You nearly destroyed them, but they refused to accept discipline. They set their faces harder than stone and refused to turn back.

verses.kjv: Therefore I said, Surely these are poor; they are foolish: for they know not the way of the LORD, nor the judgment of their God.
verses.ct: So I thought, "These are just the poor and uneducated. They're foolish because they don't understand the LORD's ways or what their God requires."

verses.kjv: I will get me unto the great men, and will speak unto them; for they have known the way of the LORD, and the judgment of their God: but these have altogether broken the yoke, and burst the bonds.
verses.ct: "I'll go to the leaders and speak with them, because surely they know the LORD's ways and what their God requires." But they too had completely thrown off every restraint and broken free from all obligations.

verses.kjv: Wherefore a lion out of the forest shall slay them, and a wolf of the evenings shall spoil them, a leopard shall watch over their cities: every one that goeth out thence shall be torn in pieces: because their transgressions are many, and their backslidings are increased.
verses.ct: That is why a lion from the forest will kill them, a wolf from the desert will destroy them, and a leopard will stalk their cities. Anyone who ventures out will be torn apart — because their sins are so many and their acts of unfaithfulness keep multiplying.

verses.kjv: How shall I pardon thee for this? thy children have forsaken me, and sworn by them that are no gods: when I had fed them to the full, they then committed adultery, and assembled themselves by troops in the harlots’ houses.
verses.ct: "Why should I forgive you for this? Your children have abandoned me and sworn oaths by things that are not gods at all. I provided for them generously, yet they committed adultery and crowded into the houses of prostitutes.

verses.kjv: They were as fed horses in the morning: every one neighed after his neighbour’s wife.
verses.ct: They are like well-fed stallions, each one lusting after his neighbor's wife.

verses.kjv: Shall I not visit for these things? saith the LORD: and shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
verses.ct: Should I not punish them for these things?" says the LORD. "Should I not bring justice against a nation like this?"

verses.kjv: Go ye up upon her walls, and destroy; but make not a full end: take away her battlements; for they are not the LORD’s.
verses.ct: "Go through her vineyards and tear them down, but don't completely destroy them. Strip away her branches, because they don't belong to the LORD.

verses.kjv: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: The people of Israel and the people of Judah have been utterly unfaithful to me," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: They have belied the LORD, and said, It is not he; neither shall evil come upon us; neither shall we see sword nor famine:
verses.ct: They have lied about the LORD and said, "He won't do anything! No disaster will come to us. We will never experience war or famine."

verses.kjv: And the prophets shall become wind, and the word is not in them: thus shall it be done unto them.
verses.ct: "The prophets are nothing but hot air — God's word isn't really in them. Let what they predict happen to them instead!"

verses.kjv: Wherefore thus saith the LORD God of hosts, Because ye speak this word, behold, I will make my words in thy mouth fire, and this people wood, and it shall devour them.
verses.ct: Therefore, this is what the LORD God of Armies says: "Because you people talk this way, pay attention — I will turn my words in your mouth into fire, and these people into firewood, and it will consume them."

verses.kjv: Lo, I will bring a nation upon you from far, O house of Israel, saith the LORD: it is a mighty nation, it is an ancient nation, a nation whose language thou knowest not, neither understandest what they say.
verses.ct: "Watch — I am bringing a distant nation against you, people of Israel," says the LORD. "It is a powerful nation, an ancient nation, a nation whose language you don't know and whose speech you can't understand.

verses.kjv: Their quiver is as an open sepulchre, they are all mighty men.
verses.ct: Their quivers are like open tombs — every one of them is a warrior.

verses.kjv: And they shall eat up thine harvest, and thy bread, which thy sons and thy daughters should eat: they shall eat up thy flocks and thine herds: they shall eat up thy vines and thy fig trees: they shall impoverish thy fenced cities, wherein thou trustedst, with the sword.
verses.ct: They will devour your harvest and your food that your sons and daughters should be eating. They will devour your flocks and herds. They will devour your grapevines and fig trees. They will use the sword to demolish your fortified cities that you rely on."

verses.kjv: Nevertheless in those days, saith the LORD, I will not make a full end with you.
verses.ct: "Yet even in those days," says the LORD, "I will not completely destroy you."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, when ye shall say, Wherefore doeth the LORD our God all these things unto us? then shalt thou answer them, Like as ye have forsaken me, and served strange gods in your land, so shall ye serve strangers in a land that is not yours.
verses.ct: When the people ask, 'Why has the LORD our God done all this to us?' you will tell them, 'Just as you abandoned me and served foreign gods in your own land, so you will serve foreigners in a land that is not yours.'"

verses.kjv: Declare this in the house of Jacob, and publish it in Judah, saying,
verses.ct: "Announce this to the descendants of Jacob and proclaim it throughout Judah:

verses.kjv: Hear now this, O foolish people, and without understanding; which have eyes, and see not; which have ears, and hear not:
verses.ct: Listen to this, you foolish people who have no understanding — you have eyes but don't see, you have ears but don't hear.

verses.kjv: Fear ye not me? saith the LORD: will ye not tremble at my presence, which have placed the sand for the bound of the sea by a perpetual decree, that it cannot pass it: and though the waves thereof toss themselves, yet can they not prevail; though they roar, yet can they not pass over it?
verses.ct: Don't you deeply revere me?" says the LORD. "Won't you tremble in my presence? I'm the one who set the sand as a boundary for the sea, an eternal limit it cannot cross. The waves may crash and churn, but they cannot overcome it. They may roar, but they cannot push past it.

verses.kjv: But this people hath a revolting and a rebellious heart; they are revolted and gone.
verses.ct: But these people have stubborn and rebellious hearts — they have turned away and left.

verses.kjv: Neither say they in their heart, Let us now fear the LORD our God, that giveth rain, both the former and the latter, in his season: he reserveth unto us the appointed weeks of the harvest.
verses.ct: They never say to themselves, 'Let us be wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD our God, who sends rain in its season — both the autumn and spring rains — and who preserves for us the set weeks of harvest.'

verses.kjv: Your iniquities have turned away these things, and your sins have withholden good things from you.
verses.ct: Your sins have disrupted all of this, and your wrongdoing has kept these good things from you.

verses.kjv: For among my people are found wicked men: they lay wait, as he that setteth snares; they set a trap, they catch men.
verses.ct: Among my people there are wicked individuals who lie in wait like hunters setting traps — they set snares to catch people.

verses.kjv: As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit: therefore they are become great, and waxen rich.
verses.ct: Like a cage packed with birds, their houses are packed with dishonest gain. That's how they've become powerful and wealthy.

verses.kjv: They are waxen fat, they shine: yea, they overpass the deeds of the wicked: they judge not the cause, the cause of the fatherless, yet they prosper; and the right of the needy do they not judge.
verses.ct: They've grown sleek and fat. They surpass even the worst in their evil deeds. They refuse to defend the rights of orphans, and they won't fight for justice for the poor — yet they still prosper.

verses.kjv: Shall I not visit for these things? saith the LORD: shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?
verses.ct: "Should I not punish them for these things?" says the LORD. "Should I not bring justice against a nation like this?"

verses.kjv: A wonderful and horrible thing is committed in the land;
verses.ct: Something shocking and horrifying has happened in the land:

verses.kjv: The prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests bear rule by their means; and my people love to have it so: and what will ye do in the end thereof?
verses.ct: The prophets deliver false messages, and the priests rule by their own authority. And my people actually love it this way! But what will you do when it all comes crashing down?
